topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 2.1: Required Patches

body.p: Occasionally, you will be asked to deploy a patch to your running HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade environment.
All patch files can be downloaded from the Helion Distribution Network (HDN). You must obtain a user account on HDN in order to download these files.

Some patches must be installed prior to deploying your cloud and some patches must be installed after the cloud is fully installed and running. Consult the following table for the patches you need to apply and when they must be applied.

section.title: Standard Region Patches
section.p: The following patches are to be applied to the servers in the standard region.
Some patches can be deployed during the installation. If you installed a patch during installation, you do not need to install the patch again.

section.title: Launch the Software Updates and Licensing site to download patches
section.p: If you did not download the , you need to manually download the patches from the Software Updates & Licensing site. You must obtain a Service Agreement ID (SAID) in order to download these files.

ol.li: In a browser, navigate to the Software Updates & Licensing site.
Click Sign In to log in using your account.
After signing in, enter your Service Agreement ID (SAID) in the Software updates and licensing page and accept the license agreement.
On the product list page, under Infrastructure Management Software, click Get software updates.
On the downloads page, click the Get Software tab.

section.title: Locate the patch
section.p: To download the patch you need from the Software Updates and Licensing site, shown above:

ol.li: Locate the product name associated with the HCG 2.1 patches.
Select the patch file and click Continue.

On the page that launches, select the download method:
Use HPE Download Manager. Click the Use the HPE Download Manager link to specify where the installation package will be saved.
Use Standard Download. Click the Download link to use the standard download method for your browser.
